intro: Lobelia siphilitica f. alba, commonly known as white cardinal flower, is a cultivar of the cardinal flower species native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its striking white flowers, which contrast sharply with the dark green foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 2 to 4 feet and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It blooms from midsummer to early fall, producing showy, tubular flowers that attract pollinators like hummingbirds and butterflies. This cultivar is valued for its ornamental appeal and its ability to naturalize in suitable habitats.
